explanation: Occurs when the Python interpreter finds incorrect syntax such as missing colons mismatched parentheses or misspelled keywords
Arises from incorrect indentation which is crucial in Python for defining code blocks This includes inconsistent use of spaces or tabs or incorrect indentation levels.
Raised when a local or global name is not found typically due to using an undefined variable or misspelling a variable/function name.
Occurs when an operation or function is applied to an object of an inappropriate type such as attempting to add a string and an integer directly.
Raised when a function receives an argument of the correct type but an inappropriate value like trying to convert a non-numeric string to an integer.
Occurs when attempting to access an index that is outside the bounds of a sequence (e.g.
Raised when a dictionary key is not found during an attempt to access or modify a dictionary entry.
